title: Azir is going to get too small of a nerf
body: To compare to how ridiculous this champ is. The C9 vs CLG game shows this. Pob got DESTROYED in lane, and yet CLG makes a huge comeback of the utility and damage of a Azir that should have been far behind and out of the game. A champ has utility or damage, not both.

replies.body:
>A champ has utility or damage, not both.

Mages tend to be a little more versatile than assassins, you know.

True, but Azir is over versatile. Poke ? Check. Zoning potential ? Check. High DPS ? Check. Disengage? Check. Engage ? Check. Shield ? Check.  1 V 1 potential ? Check. Team fight potential ? Check.  High damage to turrets and objectives ? Check. 
Question is, why would you not pick Azir ?
Question, what is a HARD counter to Azir ? Answer, there is none. His 2 major counters Zed and LB have both been nerfed and Azir out scales them anyway

To be fair, he's not amazing in solo queue at the moment (45.63% winrate in Plat+, 9.83% pick rate, 17.05% ban rate). He's very LCS hyped, tho, because he has tools pros are better with than solo queue. 

If anything, he could use a power shift. Make him a tad weaker in LCS by making him less of a swiss knife, and a tad stronger in solo queue. But not too stronger, otherwise we would face a post-cinderhulk release Sejuani/Amumu/Gragas/Nunu scenario.

Have his W range scale with rank

Waveclear
Mobility

Utility

It's unnecessary, and while I do main Azir I don't want him to be the {{champion:64}} of mages. (Come on who doesn't want a Birb Emperor)

I'm sorry I have to downvote the thread but it seems like you're just advocating a huge blanket nerf of his kit rather than selecting out his oppressive elements.

I think the simplest thing to do, is to absolutely gut his poking ability, while keeping his DPS the same (if not slightly improving it).

Maybe give Q a slightly lower cooldown to compensate along with a lower cost, so he can reposition his soldiers more often (you know, the intended function of the skill)

> [{quoted}](name=LoLKiru,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QHU96gNU,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2015-07-19T22:44:09.396+0000)

> 
> Maybe give Q a slightly lower cooldown to compensate along with a lower cost, so he can reposition his soldiers more often (you know, the intended function of the skill)

I've always thought that Q should be a repositioning tool, not a poking tool. Apparently riot doesn't think so. Q should have a slightly lower cd, less scaling (35-40%), and his Soldier auto attacks should ramp up in damage as they attack a target so his dps rises exponentially rather than linearly. He needs to be an amazing zone control DPS mage, not a poke burst caster with substantial DPS on the side.

Honestly despite you being right I don't know why this post is being upvoted, it's kind of badly worded as damage and utility is something every mage has, and the post almost calls for a complete nerf of every facet of Azir's kit rather than his actual problem.

Now I'm not going to act like I know much about the match, I don't watch LCS, but Azir is MEANT to be a lategame champion so if the game managed to last until late game then it's not surprising he became really powerful as he likely caught back up. The real problem with Azir is generally how oppressive he is early game and how much stuff he's got crammed in his kit.
make his goddamn soldiers destructable and displacable units already. thats all he needs. we need a way to counter his zoning.

> [{quoted}](name=Critmaster Garen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QHU96gNU,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-07-19T21:20:14.421+0000)
>
> make his goddamn soldiers destructable and displacable units already. thats all he needs. we need a way to counter his zoning.

But Zoning is part of his kit. I've always said that's a bad idea. If you want to make his early game zoning a bit weaker then have his soldier AA range scale with ranks put into W and have his Q damage lowered but have it do bonus damage when there's more soldiers.

Having the soldiers destructable would mean they would have really strange interactions, like what if one was broken mid dash, or what if one was broken while Azir was casting his E, or  what if Azir decided to meatshield himself from skillshots with them, would they obey unit colision? Could he just block his creeps to pull a wave?

Bad idea.

Azir is good at the pro level because he is difficult to play. He has no real weakness other than the player. When pros with hundreds of hours of experience play as him, they can do whatever they want.

It's definitely substantial enough since they completely shifted his build and you need to max w, which for an azir player is bad enough. They're also not hitting him where he actually needs to be hit. But then again I'm not really sure what the balance team has been smoking recently.

> [{quoted}](name=Lugg,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QHU96gNU,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-07-19T21:19:22.777+0000)
>
> Azir does have his weaknesses. He starts pretty slow and he is very squishy, even late game.

He does have them but he also has many things to cover his weaknesses such as ability to disengage really well and the fact he outduels basically every champion in a 1v1, not to meantion the poke that prevents people from even trying to all in him.

The problem is not Azir having both utility and damage. That's pretty standard across the board for mages. But as someone else said, the problem with Azir is that he does EVERYTHING. There's essentially nothing he's actually bad at and there is no real way for you to fight him without him getting the upper hand, should his cooldowns be available to him.

The nerfs to his E should help that, and the move of his attack speed from his passive to his W means he has to make a choice between burst and DPS in the early/mid game, so they are addressing it to at least some degree.
